News Application
  • API Documentation
  • View page source

API Documentationïƒ

news_app packageïƒ

Django models for the News Application.

This module defines the core data models including: - CustomUser: User model with role-based permissions (Reader, Editor, Journalist) - Publisher: News publishing organizations - Article: News articles with approval workflow - Newsletter: Independent newsletters from journalists

Each model includes validation, custom methods, and relationships to support the applicationâ€™s role-based access control system.

class news_app.models.Article(*args, **kwargs)[source]ïƒ

Bases: Model

Represents a news article. Articles can be independent or linked to a publisher. Requires editor approval before being visible to readers.

exception DoesNotExistïƒ

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturnedïƒ

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

exception NotUpdatedïƒ

Bases: ObjectNotUpdated, DatabaseError

approved_atïƒ

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

approved_byïƒ

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

class news_app.models.CustomUser(*args, **kwargs)[source]ïƒ

Bases: AbstractUser

Custom user model extending Djangoâ€™s AbstractUser. Supports three roles: READER, EDITOR, JOURNALIST. Each role has specific fields and permissions.

exception DoesNotExistïƒ

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturnedïƒ

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

exception NotUpdatedïƒ

Bases: ObjectNotUpdated, DatabaseError

ROLE_CHOICES = [('READER', 'Reader'), ('EDITOR', 'Editor'), ('JOURNALIST', 'Journalist')]ïƒ
approved_articlesïƒ

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_reverse_many_to_one_manager() defined below.

auth_tokenïƒ

Accessor to the related object on the reverse side of a one-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Restaurant(Model):
    place = OneToOneField(Place, related_name='restaurant')

Place.restaurant is a ReverseOneToOneDescriptor instance.

Validate that READER-specific fields are only used for readers.

groupsïƒ

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

roleïƒ

save(*args, **kwargs)[source]ïƒ

Override save to assign user to appropriate group based on role. Also ensures role-specific fields are cleared for other roles.

Views for the News Application.

This module contains all view functions that handle HTTP requests including: - Public views: Homepage, article details - Authentication: Login, logout, registration - Reader views: Dashboard, browse publishers/journalists, subscriptions - Journalist views: Create/edit articles and newsletters - Editor views: Approve articles, manage content - Publisher management: Create publishers on-the-fly

Each view includes permission checks and role-based access control.

news_app.views.article_approve(request, pk)[source]ïƒ

Approve article.

news_app.views.article_create(request)[source]ïƒ

Create new article.

news_app.views.article_delete(request, pk)[source]ïƒ

Delete article.

news_app.views.article_detail(request, slug)[source]ïƒ

Display single article by slug.

news_app.views.article_update(request, pk)[source]ïƒ

Update existing article.

news_app.views.browse_journalists(request)[source]ïƒ

Browse all journalists.

news_app.views.browse_publishers(request)[source]ïƒ

Browse all publishers.

news_app.views.editor_dashboard(request)[source]ïƒ

Editor dashboard with pending articles.

news_app.views.home(request)[source]ïƒ

Display homepage with approved articles.

news_app.views.journalist_dashboard(request)[source]ïƒ

Journalist dashboard with their articles.

news_app.views.login_view(request)[source]ïƒ

Forms for the News Application.

This module defines Django forms for user input and validation: - CustomUserCreationForm: User registration with role selection - CustomUserChangeForm: User profile updates - ArticleForm: Create and edit news articles - NewsletterForm: Create and edit newsletters - PublisherForm: Create new publishers

Forms include field validation and custom widgets for better UX.

REST API Serializers for the News Application.

This module contains Django REST Framework serializers that convert model instances to JSON for API responses: - ArticleSerializer: Serializes Article objects with related data - PublisherSerializer: Serializes Publisher objects with article counts - JournalistSerializer: Serializes journalist user data

Serializers handle data validation and nested relationships.

This module customizes the Django admin interface: - CustomUserAdmin: Manages users with role-based fields - ArticleAdmin: Manages articles with approval workflow - PublisherAdmin: Manages publishers - NewsletterAdmin: Manages newsletters

Includes custom filters, search fields, and list displays.

REST API Views for the News Application.

This module contains API endpoints for external access: - get_articles: Retrieve filtered articles - get_article_detail: Get single article details - get_publishers: List all publishers with article counts - get_journalists: List journalists with their articles

All endpoints require token authentication and appropriate permissions.

news_app.api_views.api_login(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]ïƒ

POST /api/login/ Accepts username and password, returns authentication token. Body: {â€œusernameâ€: â€œchrisâ€, â€œpasswordâ€: â€œpassword123â€} Returns: {â€œtokenâ€: â€œabc123xyzâ€, â€œuser_idâ€: 5, â€œusernameâ€: â€œchrisâ€, â€œroleâ€: â€œJOURNALISTâ€}

news_app.api_views.create_article(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]ïƒ

POST /api/articles/create/ Creates new article. Requires authentication and JOURNALIST role.

news_app.api_views.subscribe_to_journalist(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]ïƒ

POST /api/subscribe/journalist/{id}/ Subscribes authenticated user to a journalist. Requires authentication.

news_app.api_views.subscribe_to_publisher(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]ïƒ

POST /api/subscribe/publisher/{id}/ Subscribes authenticated user to a publisher. Requires authentication.

news_app.api_views.view_article_detail(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]ïƒ

GET /api/articles/{id}/ Returns single article by ID. No authentication required.

news_app.api_views.view_articles(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]ïƒ

GET /api/articles/ Returns list of all approved articles. No authentication required.

news_app.api_views.view_journalists(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]ïƒ

GET /api/journalists/ Returns list of all journalists. No authentication required.

news_app.api_views.view_publishers(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]ïƒ

GET /api/publishers/ Returns list of all publishers. No authentication required.

URL Configuration for the News Application.

This module defines all URL patterns routing requests to views: - Public URLs: Homepage, article details - Authentication URLs: Login, logout, registration - Role-specific URLs: Reader, journalist, and editor dashboards - API URLs: REST API endpoints with /api/ prefix

Uses Djangoâ€™s path() function for clean URL patterns.

Test Suite for the News Application.

This module contains comprehensive automated tests including: - Model tests: CustomUser, Article, Publisher, Newsletter - View tests: Authentication, permissions, CRUD operations - API tests: Token authentication, endpoint responses - Integration tests: Complete user workflows

Uses Django TestCase and REST Framework APIClient.

class news_app.tests.APIAuthenticationTests(methodName='runTest')[source]ïƒ

Bases: TestCase

Making sure users can log in and get authentication tokens. Think of tokens like a special key that lets you access protected areas.

Before each test, create some fake users to test with.

class news_app.tests.ArticleRetrievalBySubscriptionTests(methodName='runTest')[source]ïƒ

Bases: TestCase

â­â­â­ THIS IS THE MOST IMPORTANT TEST! â­â­â­

The task says: â€œverify that your API returns the correct articles based on the subscriptions of the API client (reader).â€

This test creates a realistic scenario: - A reader subscribes to some publishers/journalists (but not all) - We create several articles from different sources - We check that the API returns the right articles

Itâ€™s like testing if your personalized news feed shows the right stories!

Create a complete test scenario with publishers, journalists, readers, and articles.

â­ THE BIG TEST â­

Django Signals for the News Application.

This module defines signal handlers for automated actions: - Article approval notifications: Email editors when articles submitted - User creation handlers: Set up initial permissions and groups - Post-save actions: Trigger related updates

Uses Djangoâ€™s signal dispatcher for event-driven functionality.

news_app.signals.get_subscribers_for_article(article)[source]ïƒ

Collect all subscribers who should be notified about this article. Includes subscribers to the publisher and subscribers to the journalist. Returns a list of unique CustomUser objects.

news_app.signals.handle_article_approval(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)[source]ïƒ

Handle article approval by sending emails and posting to X. Triggered when an articleâ€™s approval status changes from False to True.

news_app.signals.invalidate_user_sessions_on_role_change(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)[source]ïƒ

When a userâ€™s role changes, invalidate all their active sessions. This forces them to log in again to get the updated role/permissions.

news_app.signals.send_email_to_subscribers(article)[source]ïƒ

Send email notification to all subscribers when article is approved. Subscribers include those subscribed to the publisher or the journalist.

news_app.signals.store_previous_approval_status(sender, instance, **kwargs)[source]ïƒ

Store the previous approval status before saving. This allows us to detect when approval status changes from False to True.

news_app.signals.store_previous_role(sender, instance, **kwargs)[source]ïƒ

Store the previous role before saving. This allows us to detect when a userâ€™s role changes.

Twitter Integration Utilities for the News Application.

This module handles Twitter API integration: - Tweet posting: Automatically share approved articles - Authentication: Twitter API credentials management - Error handling: Graceful fallbacks for API failures

Uses Tweepy library for Twitter API communication.

Initialize and return Twitter API client for posting tweets.
